member.name: T:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUA1Checker
member.summary:
The class defines the requirements of the PDF/UA-1 standard and contains method implementations from the abstract
class.
member.remarks:
The class defines the requirements of the PDF/UA-1 standard and contains method implementations from the abstract
class.
The specification implemented by this class is ISO 14289-1.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUA1Checker.#ctor(iText.Kernel.Pdf.PdfDocument)
member.summary: Creates PdfUA1Checker instance with PDF document which will be validated against PDF/UA-1 standard.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUA1Checker.CheckFileSpec(iText.Kernel.Pdf.PdfDictionary)
member.summary: Verify the conformity of the file specification dictionary.
member.param:
the
containing file specification to be checked

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUA1Checker.CheckMetadata(iText.Kernel.Pdf.PdfCatalog)
member.summary: Checks that the Catalog dictionary of a conforming file (the version number of a file may be any value from 1.0 to 1.7) contains the Metadata key whose value is a metadata stream.
member.remarks:
Checks that the Catalog dictionary of a conforming file (the version number of a file may be any value from 1.0 to 1.7) contains the Metadata key whose value is a metadata stream. Also checks that the value of pdfuaid:part is 1 for conforming PDF files.
Checks that the Metadata stream in the document catalog dictionary includes a dc:title entry reflecting the title of the document.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUA1Checker.CheckNonSymbolicCmapSubtable(iText.IO.Font.TrueTypeFont)
member.summary: For all non-symbolic TrueType fonts used for rendering, the embedded TrueType font program shall contain one or several non-symbolic cmap entries such that all necessary glyph lookups can be carried out.
member.param: the embedded TrueType font program to check

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUA1Checker.CheckSymbolicCmapSubtable(iText.IO.Font.TrueTypeFont)
member.summary: Checks cmap entries present in the embedded TrueType font program of the symbolic TrueType font.
member.remarks:
Checks cmap entries present in the embedded TrueType font program of the symbolic TrueType font.
The “cmap” table in the embedded font program shall either contain exactly one encoding or it shall contain, at least, the Microsoft Symbol (3,0 – Platform ID = 3, Encoding ID = 0) encoding.
member.param: the embedded TrueType font program to check

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUA1Checker.CheckPdfObject(iText.Kernel.Pdf.PdfObject)
member.summary: This method checks the requirements that must be fulfilled by a COS object in a PDF/UA document.
member.param: the COS object that must be checked

member.name: T:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUA2Checker
member.summary:
The class defines the requirements of the PDF/UA-2 standard and contains method implementations from the abstract
class.
member.remarks:
The class defines the requirements of the PDF/UA-2 standard and contains method implementations from the abstract
class.
The specification implemented by this class is ISO 14289-2.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUA2Checker.#ctor(iText.Kernel.Pdf.PdfDocument)
member.summary:
Creates
instance with PDF document which will be validated against PDF/UA-2 standard.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUA2Checker.CheckMetadata(iText.Kernel.Pdf.PdfCatalog)
member.summary: Checks that the Catalog dictionary of a conforming file contains the Metadata key whose value is a metadata stream as defined in ISO 32000-2:2020.
member.remarks:
Checks that the Catalog dictionary of a conforming file contains the Metadata key whose value is a metadata stream as defined in ISO 32000-2:2020. Also checks that the value of pdfuaid:part is 2 for conforming PDF files and validates required pdfuaid:rev value.
Checks that the Metadata stream as specified in ISO 32000-2:2020, 14.3 in the document catalog dictionary includes a dc: title entry reflecting the title of the document.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUA2Checker.CheckNonSymbolicCmapSubtable(iText.IO.Font.TrueTypeFont)
member.summary: For all non-symbolic TrueType fonts used for rendering, the embedded TrueType font program shall contain at least the Microsoft Unicode (3, 1 – Platform ID = 3, Encoding ID = 1), or the Macintosh Roman (1, 0 – Platform ID = 1, Encoding ID = 0) “cmap” subtable.
member.param: the embedded TrueType font program to check

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUA2Checker.CheckSymbolicCmapSubtable(iText.IO.Font.TrueTypeFont)
member.summary: Checks cmap entries present in the embedded TrueType font program of the symbolic TrueType font.
member.remarks:
Checks cmap entries present in the embedded TrueType font program of the symbolic TrueType font.
The “cmap” subtable in the embedded font program shall either contain the Microsoft Symbol (3, 0 – Platform ID = 3, Encoding ID = 0) or the Mac Roman (1, 0 – Platform ID = 1, Encoding ID = 1) encoding.
member.param: the embedded TrueType font program to check

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUA2Checker.CheckCatalog(iText.Kernel.Pdf.PdfCatalog)
member.summary: Validates document catalog dictionary against PDF/UA-2 standard.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUA2Checker.CheckFormFieldsAndAnnotations(iText.Kernel.Pdf.PdfCatalog)
member.summary: Validates all annotations and form fields present in the document against PDF/UA-2 standard.
member.param: to check form fields present in the acroform

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUA2Checker.CheckStructureTreeRoot(iText.Kernel.Pdf.Tagging.PdfStructTreeRoot)
member.summary: Validates structure tree root dictionary against PDF/UA-2 standard.
member.remarks:
Validates structure tree root dictionary against PDF/UA-2 standard.
Additionally, checks that within a given explicitly provided namespace, structure types are not role mapped to other structure types in the same namespace. In the StructTreeRoot RoleMap there is no explicitly provided namespace, that's why it is not checked.
member.param: structure tree root dictionary to check

member.name: T:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUAChecker
member.summary: An abstract class that will run through all necessary checks defined in the different PDF/UA standards.
member.remarks:
An abstract class that will run through all necessary checks defined in the different PDF/UA standards. A number of common checks are executed in this class, while standard-dependent specifications are implemented in the available subclasses. The standard that is followed is the series of ISO 14289 specifications, currently generations 1 and 2.
While it is possible to subclass this method and implement its abstract methods in client code, this is not encouraged and will have little effect. It is not possible to plug custom implementations into iText, because iText should always refuse to create non-compliant PDF/UA, which would be possible with client code implementations. Any future generations of the PDF/UA standard and its derivatives will get their own implementation in the iText - pdfua project.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUAChecker.#ctor
member.summary:
Creates new
instance.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUAChecker.WarnOnPageFlush
member.summary: Logs a warn on page flushing that page flushing is disabled in PDF/UA mode.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUAChecker.CheckLang(iText.Kernel.Pdf.PdfCatalog)
member.summary: Checks that the default natural language for content and text strings is specified using the Lang entry, with a nonempty value, in the document catalog dictionary.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUAChecker.CheckViewerPreferences(iText.Kernel.Pdf.PdfCatalog)
member.summary:
Checks that the ViewerPreferences dictionary of the document catalog dictionary is present and contains at least the DisplayDocTitle key with a value of
, as defined in ISO 32000-1:2008, 12.2, Table 150 or ISO 32000-2:2020, Table 147.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUAChecker.CheckOCProperties(iText.Kernel.Pdf.PdfDictionary)
member.summary: Checks that all optional content configuration dictionaries in the file, including the default one, shall contain a Name entry (see ISO 32000-2:2020, Table 96, or ISO 32000-1:2008, 8.11.2.1, Table 98) whose value is a non-empty text string when document contains a Configs entry in the OCProperties entry of the document catalog dictionary (see ISO 32000-2:2020, Table 29, or ISO 32000-1:2008, 7.7.2, Table 28), and the Configs entry contains at least one optional content configuration dictionary.
member.remarks:
Checks that all optional content configuration dictionaries in the file, including the default one, shall contain a Name entry (see ISO 32000-2:2020, Table 96, or ISO 32000-1:2008, 8.11.2.1, Table 98) whose value is a non-empty text string when document contains a Configs entry in the OCProperties entry of the document catalog dictionary (see ISO 32000-2:2020, Table 29, or ISO 32000-1:2008, 7.7.2, Table 28), and the Configs entry contains at least one optional content configuration dictionary.
Also checks that the AS key does not appear in any optional content configuration dictionary.
member.param: OCProperties entry of the Catalog dictionary

member.summary: Checks if content marked as Artifact resides in Artifact content, but real content does not.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUAChecker.CheckContentInCanvas(System.Collections.Generic.Stack{iText.Commons.Datastructures.Tuple2{iText.Kernel.Pdf.PdfName,iText.Kernel.Pdf.PdfDictionary}},iText.Kernel.Pdf.PdfDocument)
member.summary: Checks if content is neither marked as Artifact nor tagged as real content.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.PdfUAChecker.CheckFonts(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{iText.Kernel.Font.PdfFont})
member.summary: Checks that font programs for all fonts used for rendering within a conforming file, as determined by whether at least one of its glyphs is referenced from one or more content streams, are embedded within that file, as defined in ISO 32000-2:2020, 9.9 and ISO 32000-1:2008, 9.9.
member.remarks:
Checks that font programs for all fonts used for rendering within a conforming file, as determined by whether at least one of its glyphs is referenced from one or more content streams, are embedded within that file, as defined in ISO 32000-2:2020, 9.9 and ISO 32000-1:2008, 9.9.
Checks character encodings rules as defined in ISO 14289-2, 8.4.5.7 and ISO 14289-1, 7.21.6.
member.param: collection of fonts used in the document

member.summary: Checks cmap entries present in the embedded TrueType font program of the non-symbolic TrueType font.

member.summary: Checks cmap entries present in the embedded TrueType font program of the symbolic TrueType font.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.Utils.PdfUAValidationContext.GetElementIfRoleMatches(iText.Kernel.Pdf.PdfName,iText.Kernel.Pdf.Tagging.IStructureNode)
member.summary:
Checks if a
resolved role's is equal to the provided role.
member.remarks:
Checks if a
resolved role's is equal to the provided role.
Note: This method will not check recursive mapping. So either the node's role is the provided role, or the standard role is the provided role. So we do not take into account the roles in between the mappings.
member.param: The role we want to check against.
The structure node we want to check.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.Utils.Ua2.PdfUA2FormChecker.CheckWidgetAnnotations(iText.Kernel.Pdf.PdfDocument)
member.summary: Verifies the conformity of the widget annotation present in the document.
member.remarks:
Verifies the conformity of the widget annotation present in the document.
Checks that each widget annotation is either Form structure element or an Artifact; if label for a widget annotation is not present or an additional action (AA) entry is present, Contents entry is provided.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.Utils.Ua2.PdfUA2FormChecker.CheckFormFields(iText.Kernel.Pdf.PdfDictionary)
member.summary: Verifies the conformity of the document Acroform dictionary.
member.remarks:
Verifies the conformity of the document Acroform dictionary.
Checks that each widget annotation is either Form structure element or an Artifact; if label for a widget annotation is not present or an additional action (AA) entry is present, Contents entry is provided; text field RV and V values are textually equal.

member.name: T:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.Utils.Ua2.PdfUA2HeadingsChecker
member.summary: Utility class which performs headings check according to PDF/UA-2 specification.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.Utils.Ua2.PdfUA2HeadingsChecker.#ctor(iText.Pdfua.Checkers.Utils.PdfUAValidationContext)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of .

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.Utils.Ua2.PdfUA2HeadingsChecker.CheckLayoutElement(iText.Layout.Renderer.IRenderer)
member.summary: Checks if layout element has correct heading according to PDF/UA-2 specification.
member.remarks:
Checks if layout element has correct heading according to PDF/UA-2 specification.
Conforming files shall use the explicitly numbered heading structure types (H1-Hn) and shall not use the H structure type.
Note, that PDF/UA-2 specification does not include requirements on the use of sequential heading levels. But where a heading’s level is evident, the heading level of the structure element enclosing it shall match that heading level, e.g. a heading with the real content “5.1.6.4 Some header” is evidently at heading level 4. This requirement is not checked.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.Utils.Ua2.PdfUA2HeadingsChecker.CheckStructElement(iText.Kernel.Pdf.Tagging.IStructureNode)
member.summary: Checks if layout element has correct heading according to PDF/UA-2 specification.
member.remarks:
Checks if layout element has correct heading according to PDF/UA-2 specification.
Conforming files shall use the explicitly numbered heading structure types (H1-Hn) and shall not use the H structure type.
Note, that PDF/UA-2 specification does not include requirements on the use of sequential heading levels. But where a heading’s level is evident, the heading level of the structure element enclosing it shall match that heading level, e.g. a heading with the real content “5.1.6.4 Some header” is evidently at heading level 4. This requirement is not checked.

member.summary: Handler class that checks heading tags while traversing the tag tree.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.Utils.Ua2.PdfUA2LinkChecker.CheckLinkAnnotationStructureParent(iText.Kernel.Pdf.Tagging.IStructureNode)
member.summary: Checks that link annotation is enclosed in either a Link or Reference structure element.
member.remarks:
Checks that link annotation is enclosed in either a Link or Reference structure element.
Also checks that link annotations that target different locations are in separate Link or Reference structure elements, and multiple link annotations targeting the same location are included in a single Link or Reference structure element.
member.param: link annotation object reference in the structure tree

member.summary: Checks that link annotations that target different locations (destinations) are in separate Link or Reference structure elements, and multiple link annotations targeting the same location are included in a single Link or Reference structure element.
member.param: link annotation object reference in the structure tree

member.summary: Checks if list element has correct tag structure according to PDF/UA-2 specification.
member.remarks:
Checks if list element has correct tag structure according to PDF/UA-2 specification.
Conforming files shall tag any real content within LI structure element as either Lbl or LBody. For list items, if Lbl is present, not None ListNumbering attribute shall be specified on the respective L structure element.

member.name: M:iText.Pdfua.Checkers.Utils.Ua2.PdfUA2TableOfContentsChecker.CheckRefInTociStructElement(iText.Kernel.Pdf.Tagging.IStructureNode)
member.summary: Checks that table of contents item identifies the target of the reference according to PDF/UA-2 specification.
member.remarks:
Checks that table of contents item identifies the target of the reference according to PDF/UA-2 specification.
Each TOCI in the table of contents shall identify the target of the reference using the Ref entry, either directly on the TOCI structure element itself or on a child structure element contained within, such as a Reference structure element.
